text: grapes like these offer bunches of
possibilities of course they're
delicious eaten right out of hand but
you can also do some fun and unexpected
things with them and I have three ideas
here for you
grape salsa any one it's like a pico de
gallo and cept instead of tomatoes
you're using grapes sounds a little odd
but like tomatoes grapes are a fruit
sweet and tart and it's beautiful also
frozen and pureed with mint and lemon
and a little corn syrup for sweetness
into a beautiful sorbet no ice cream
machine required and this might be my
favorite technique oven drying in a 225
degree oven this is just a bunch of red
grapes that I've washed and after 8
hours in the oven they become wrinkly
and soft and then all you have to do is
chill them for at least an hour and you
have a wonderful snack to accompany
cheese and crackers I'm gonna get these
into the oven and then I'll show you how
to serve them our grapes have
transformed into something akin to a
raisin only juicier but they're very
soft and sweet tart and they're so
delicious with a creamy smooth cheese
like this camembert from Normandy and
they're excellent with crackers as well
let me just show you how you should be
eating this you can cut the camembert
into little wedges brie would work too
you could even warm it to make it nice
and gooey and that goes onto a little
cracker with a few of these delicious
raisins and that makes for an unexpected
and really delicious addition to a
cheese board now to serve the sorbet
very simple have a scoop in warm water
so that it scoops easily this sorbet is
bursting with grape flavor so delicious
and of course the pico de gallo with
tortilla chips and it's flavored with
lime juice cilantro and jalapeno for a
little bit of heat and there it is 3
totally unexpected and really delicious
ways to use the abundance of grapes
happy eating
